history.proof: intros D E Heq Hclosed. unfold closed in *. intros x Hloc. qsimpl time: 1. hauto.

exceptions.exn: In environment T : UniformSpace D, E : T -> Prop Heq : forall x : T, D x <-> E x Hclosed : forall x : T, ~ locally x (fun x0 : T => ~ D x0) -> D x x : T Hloc : ~ locally x (fun x : T => ~ E x) Unable to unify "D ?M2435" with "E x".

In environment T : UniformSpace D, E : T -> Prop Hclosed : forall x : T, (locally x (fun x0 : T => D x0 -> False) -> False) -> D x x : T Hloc : locally x (fun x : T => E x -> False) -> False H : forall x : T, E x -> D x H0 : forall x : T, D x -> E x Unable to unify "False" with "E x".

chat.content:
Help me to prove a theorem in Coq, based on provided proof states including hypotheses and goals. Give a complete proof in only one single code block without explanations, extra definitions. Give a complete proof in one response, only give the proof body, without repeating the definition and "Proof.". Avoid existing names when using intros. Write the commands separately, without ";" and "[cmd|cmd]". Use bullets for structure, NEVER use "{" and "}". When -, + and * are used out, proceed to double versions like --, ++, etc. For example, given proof state:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m
============================
m + S n = S n + m
The hypotheses n, m: nat and IHn: m + n = n + m are given first, then the goal, m + S n = S n + m, separated by =. Expect a response like: 
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.``` 
You do not intros any terms because all terms have already been introduced.

When I give:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m
============================
n, m: nat
your answer should be like:
```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```
Definitions and lemmas related to the proof will be provided, use them accordingly.


Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
T: UniformSpace

Goal:
forall D E : T -> Prop, (forall x : T, D x <-> E x) -> closed D -> closed E

Premises:
closed = fun D : T -> Prop => forall x : T, ~ locally x (fun x0 : T => ~ D x0) -> D x : (T -> Prop) -> Prop Argument scope is [function_scope]
Inductive GFormula (TA TX AA AF : Type) : Type := TT : Tauto.GFormula | FF : Tauto.GFormula | X : TX -> Tauto.GFormula | A : TA -> AA -> Tauto.GFormula | Cj : Tauto.GFormula -> Tauto.GFormula -> Tauto.GFormula | D : Tauto.GFormula -> Tauto.GFormula -> Tauto.GFormula | N : Tauto.GFormula -> Tauto.GFormula | I : Tauto.GFormula -> option AF -> Tauto.GFormula -> Tauto.GFormula For GFormula: Arguments TA, TX, AA, AF are implicit and maximally inserted For TT: Arguments TA, TX, AA, AF are implicit and maximally inserted For FF: Arguments TA, TX, AA, AF are implicit and maximally inserted For X: Arguments TA, TX, AA, AF are implicit and maximally inserted For A: Arguments TA, TX, AA, AF are implicit and maximally inserted For Cj:
Module FSetPositive.PositiveSet.E : Sig Definition t : Set. Definition eq : positive -> positive -> Prop. Definition eq_refl : forall x : t, x = x. Definition eq_sym : forall x y : t, x = y -> y = x. Definition eq_trans : forall x y z : t, x = y -> y = z -> x = z. Definition bits_lt : positive -> positive -> Prop. Definition lt : positive -> positive -> Prop. Definition bits_lt_trans : forall x y z : positive, bits_lt x y -> bits_lt y z -> bits_lt x z. Definition lt_trans : forall x y z : t, lt x y -> lt y z -> lt x z. Definition bits_lt_antirefl : forall x : positive, ~ bits_lt x x. Definition lt_not_eq : forall x y : t, lt x y -> ~ eq x y. Definition compare : forall x y : t, OrderedType.Compare lt eq x y. Definition eq_dec :
open_not : forall D : T -> Prop, closed D -> open (fun x : T => ~ D x)
closed_not : forall D : T -> Prop, open D -> closed (fun x : T => ~ D x)
open_ext : forall D E : ?T -> Prop, (forall x : ?T, D x <-> E x) -> open D -> open E where ?T : [T : UniformSpace |- UniformSpace]
locally_open : forall D E : ?T -> Prop, open D -> (forall x : ?T, D x -> E x) -> forall x : ?T, D x -> locally x E where ?T : [T : UniformSpace |- UniformSpace]
open_and : forall D E : ?T -> Prop, open D -> open E -> open (fun x : ?T => D x /\ E x) where ?T : [T : UniformSpace |- UniformSpace]
open_or : forall D E : ?T -> Prop, open D -> open E -> open (fun x : ?T => D x \/ E x) where ?T : [T : UniformSpace |- UniformSpace]
open = fun (T : UniformSpace) (D : T -> Prop) => forall x : T, D x -> locally x D : forall T : UniformSpace, (T -> Prop) -> Prop Argument T is implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [_ function_scope]
completeness : forall E : R -> Prop, bound E -> (exists x : R, E x) -> {m : R | is_lub E m}
open_comp : forall (f : ?T -> ?U) (D : ?U -> Prop), (forall x : ?T, D (f x) -> filterlim f (locally x) (locally (f x))) -> open D -> open (fun x : ?T => D (f x)) where ?T : [T : UniformSpace |- UniformSpace] ?U : [T : UniformSpace |- UniformSpace]
within_filter : forall (T : Type) (D : T -> Type) (F : (T -> Prop) -> Prop), Filter F -> Filter (within D F)
ex_glb_Rbar : forall E : R -> Prop, {l : Rbar | is_glb_Rbar E l}
ex_lub_Rbar : forall E : R -> Prop, {l : Rbar | is_lub_Rbar E l}
within = fun (T : Type) (D : T -> Type) (F : (T -> Prop) -> Prop) (P : T -> Prop) => F (fun x : T => D x -> P x) : forall T : Type, (T -> Type) -> ((T -> Prop) -> Prop) -> (T -> Prop) -> Prop Argument T is implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [type_scope function_scope function_scope function_scope]
is_glb_Rbar_unique : forall (E : R -> Prop) (l : Rbar), is_glb_Rbar E l -> Glb_Rbar E = l
is_lub_Rbar_unique : forall (E : R -> Prop) (l : Rbar), is_lub_Rbar E l -> Lub_Rbar E = l
Build_Filter : forall (T : Type) (F : (T -> Prop) -> Prop), F (fun _ : T => True) -> (forall P Q : T -> Prop, F P -> F Q -> F (fun x : T => P x /\ Q x)) -> (forall P Q : T -> Prop, (forall x : T, P x -> Q x) -> F P -> F Q) -> Filter F
Build_ProperFilter : forall (T : Type) (F : (T -> Prop) -> Prop), (forall P : T -> Prop, F P -> exists x : T, P x) -> Filter F -> ProperFilter F
is_glb_Rbar = fun (E : R -> Prop) (l : Rbar) => is_lb_Rbar E l /\ (forall b : Rbar, is_lb_Rbar E b -> Rbar_le b l) : (R -> Prop) -> Rbar -> Prop Argument scopes are [function_scope _]
is_lub = fun (E : R -> Prop) (m : R) => is_upper_bound E m /\ (forall b : R, is_upper_bound E b -> m <= b) : (R -> Prop) -> R -> Prop Argument scopes are [function_scope R_scope]
Rbar_is_glb = fun (E : Rbar -> Prop) (l : Rbar) => Rbar_is_lower_bound E l /\ (forall b : Rbar, Rbar_is_lower_bound E b -> Rbar_le b l) : (Rbar -> Prop) -> Rbar -> Prop Argument scopes are [function_scope _]
Rbar_is_lub = fun (E : Rbar -> Prop) (l : Rbar) => Rbar_is_upper_bound E l /\ (forall b : Rbar, Rbar_is_upper_bound E b -> Rbar_le l b) : (Rbar -> Prop) -> Rbar -> Prop Argument scopes are [function_scope _]
is_lub_Rbar = fun (E : R -> Prop) (l : Rbar) => is_ub_Rbar E l /\ (forall b : Rbar, is_ub_Rbar E b -> Rbar_le l b) : (R -> Prop) -> Rbar -> Prop Argument scopes are [function_scope _]
is_ub_Rbar = fun (E : R -> Prop) (l : Rbar) => forall x : R, E x -> Rbar_le x l : (R -> Prop) -> Rbar -> Prop Argument scopes are [function_scope _]
is_lb_Rbar = fun (E : R -> Prop) (l : Rbar) => forall x : R, E x -> Rbar_le l x : (R -> Prop) -> Rbar -> Prop Argument scopes are [function_scope _]
is_upper_bound = fun (E : R -> Prop) (m : R) => forall x : R, E x -> x <= m : (R -> Prop) -> R -> Prop Argument scopes are [function_scope R_scope]
Rbar_is_lower_bound = fun (E : Rbar -> Prop) (l : Rbar) => forall x : Rbar, E x -> Rbar_le l x : (Rbar -> Prop) -> Rbar -> Prop Argument scopes are [function_scope _]
Rbar_is_upper_bound = fun (E : Rbar -> Prop) (l : Rbar) => forall x : Rbar, E x -> Rbar_le x l : (Rbar -> Prop) -> Rbar -> Prop Argument scopes are [function_scope _]
Record Filter (T : Type) (F : (T -> Prop) -> Prop) : Prop := Build_Filter { filter_true : F (fun _ : T => True); filter_and : forall P Q : T -> Prop, F P -> F Q -> F (fun x : T => P x /\ Q x); filter_imp : forall P Q : T -> Prop, (forall x : T, P x -> Q x) -> F P -> F Q } For Filter: Argument T is implicit and maximally inserted For Filter: Argument scopes are [type_scope function_scope] For Build_Filter: Argument scopes are [type_scope function_scope _ function_scope function_scope]
PropExtensionalityFacts.PropExt_and_PropFunExt_imp_PredExt : (forall A B : Prop, A <-> B -> A = B) -> (forall (A : Type) (P Q : A -> Prop), (forall x : A, P x = Q x) -> P = Q) -> forall (A : Type) (P Q : A -> Prop), (forall x : A, P x <-> Q x) -> P = Q
PropExtensionalityFacts.PredExt_imp_PropExt : (forall (A : Type) (P Q : A -> Prop), (forall x : A, P x <-> Q x) -> P = Q) -> forall A B : Prop, A < -> B -> A = B

```coq
intros D E Heq Hclosed.
unfold closed in *.
intros x Hloc.
apply Hclosed.
intros H.
apply Hloc.
intros x0 Hneg.
apply (H (fun x1 => ~ E x1)).
intros y Hy.
apply Hneg.
rewrite <- Heq.
exact Hy.
Qed.
```

original: intros D E Heq Hclosed. unfold closed in *. intros x Hloc. apply Hclosed. intros H. apply Hloc. intros x0 Hneg. apply (H (fun x1 => ~ E x1)). intros y Hy. apply Hneg. rewrite <- Heq. apply Hy.
